meanings.definition: To have been in charge or presided over a meeting or organization.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, Sarah chairmanned the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: The principal chairmanned the important board meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat chairmanned the gathering of birds in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The sun chairmanned the celestial symphony of planets and stars.
meanings.sent5: The queen bee chairmanned the buzzing hive with authority.

meanings.definition: To have been the leader or head of a group or committee.
meanings.sent1: Last week, Tom chairmanned the student council meeting.
meanings.sent2: Sheila chairmanned the charity event with great success.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel chairmanned the nut-gathering expedition in the park.
meanings.sent4: The wind chairmanned the dance of the leaves in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The captain chairmanned the ship through the stormy seas bravely.
